So I have two lists, A and B. I put them into `lists = {A,B}`I want to sort A such that `Im[#1]<Im[#2]&` which I can do fine through `Sort[]` .The problem is that I want to keep the order the same so that A[[1]] stays with B[[1]] and A[[n]] stays with B[[n]]. When I try `SortBy[lists\\[Transpose],Im]` it does not sort in the same order as the sort function does, but it keeps the A[[n]] with the B[[n]] EDIT::Example (I still can't figure out how to nicely format)               A={0.651301, 0.671298, -0.000107956 + 0.735512 I,  9.93631*10^-6 + 0.764605 I, 0.965926,     0.97048, 0.0344992 + 1.4214 I,  0.0028631 + 1.4505 I, -0.0626803 + 1.78014 I, -0.12443 + 1.98252 I,  0.167724 + 2.24691 I}                    B={{-2.44558*10^-6 - 1.01111*10^-6 I, -5.65309*10^-6 + 0.000018407 I,        0.000141659 + 0.0000359384 I,        0.000116428 - 0.000796561 I, -0.00506101 - 0.000580627 I,        0.000125772 + 0.0163992 I, 0.0817805 + 9.02056*10^-16 I,        0.000126129 + 0.0177878 I, 0.00153561 - 0.000581627 I,        0.000126597 + 0.000582107 I, -9.00118*10^-7 -         0.0000107003 I, -0.0000285126 - 0.0000117884 I, -0.0000659084 +         0.000214604 I, 0.00165158 + 0.000419 I,        0.00135741 - 0.00928697 I, -0.0590055 - 0.00676943 I,        0.00146635 + 0.191195 I, 0.953465 + 0.
